# iosxr_frequency_synchronization (Resource)

This resource can manage the Frequency Synchronization configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "iosxr_frequency_synchronization" "example" {
  quality_itu_t_option_one           = true
  clock_interface_timing_mode_system = true
  system_timing_mode_clock_only      = true
  log_selection_changes              = true
  clock_identity_mac_address         = "00:11:22:33:44:55"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `clock_identity_mac_address` (String) MAC address to use to form the clock ID
- `clock_interface_timing_mode_independent` (Boolean) Use the line interfaces for clock-interface output, which is not looped back to the clock-interface input
- `clock_interface_timing_mode_system` (Boolean) Use the system's selected timing source for clock-interface output
- `delete_mode` (String) Configure behavior when deleting/destroying the resource. Either delete the entire object (YANG container) being managed, or only delete the individual resource attributes configured explicitly and leave everything else as-is. Default value is `all`.
  - Choices: `all`, `attributes`
- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.
- `log_selection_changes` (Boolean) Log both selection changes and errors
- `log_selection_errors` (Boolean) Log selection errors
- `quality_itu_t_option_one` (Boolean) ITU-T QL option 1
- `quality_itu_t_option_two_generation_one` (Boolean) ITU-T QL option 2, generation 1
- `quality_itu_t_option_two_generation_two` (Boolean) ITU-T QL option 2, generation 2
- `system_timing_mode_clock_only` (Boolean) Use only clock-interfaces for system timing
- `system_timing_mode_line_only` (Boolean) Use only line-interfaces for system timing

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The path of the object.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import iosxr_frequency_synchronization.example ""
```
